episode_title: 220 - The One Where Old Yeller Dies
note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Phoebe enters to see Monica, Richard, Ross, and Rachel tearfully watching TV.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey. Watcha guys doin?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Monica’s making us watch Old Yeller .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why are you guys so upset? It’s Old Yeller , it’s a happy movie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’re you talkin’ about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: C’mon, happy family gets a dog, frontier fun.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah but Phoebs, what about the end?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What when Yeller saves saves the family from the wolf and everyone’s happy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s not the end.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yu-huh. That’s when my mother would shut off the TV and say ‘The end’.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What about the part where he has rabies?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He doesn’t have rabies, he has babies. That’s what my mom said.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Uh, Phoebe, I don’t think your mom would want you to see what’s about to happen.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What, what’s about to happen? [starts watching] I’ve never seen this part before. Hey, Travis, watcha doin’ with that gun? Oh no, no no Travis, put down the gun. No no no no, he he’s your buddy, he’s your Yeller, no, no no, the end, THE END. [hear the gunshot from the TV] [Scene:Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Richard is on the balcony smoking and Monica is on the phone.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, have you guys eaten, because uh, Richard and I just finished and we’ve got leftovers… Chicken and potatoes… What am I wearing?…Actually, nothing but rubber gloves.
[Chandler and Joey come sprinting in]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ya know, one of these times you’re gonna really be naked and we’re not gonna come over.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, I’ve got a leg, three breasts and a wing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, how do you find clothes that fit?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hey, Monica, we’ve got a question.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, for the bizillionth time, yes I see other women in shower at the gym, and no I don’t look.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, not that one. We’re trying to figure out who to bring to the Knicks game tonight, we have an extra ticket.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, Ross can’t go so it’s between my friend Eric Prower who has breath issues and Dan with the poking. [starts poking Monica in the shoulder] ’did you see that play? Do you want some more beer? Is that Spike Lee?’

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok. [Richard walks in] Hey, why don’t you ask Richard?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ok, uh, hey Richard, if you had an extra ticket to the Knicks game and you had to choose between a friend who smells and one who bruises you who would you pick?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Wow. Well being a huge Knicks fan myself, I think you should take someone who’s a huge Knicks fan.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, that’s Eric.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Glad to be of help. Matches. [walks out to the balcony]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I meant, why don’t you take Richard to the game? What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: C’mon. Keeps his fingers to himself and he’s always minty fresh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know, Richard’s really nice and everything, uh, it’s just that we don’t know him really well, ya know, and plus he’s, ya know, old [Monica gives him a glare] -er than some people, but, uh, younger than some buildings.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what, he’s a little older, big deal, I mean he’s important to me. Ya know if you ask him, he might take you on his Jag. [walks off]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How do we say yes now and make it seem like we’re not doin’ it just to ride in the cool car?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, this could be tough.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [Monica walks back in the kitchen] Ok ok ok ok. Monica, we’ll bring him, but only if he takes the Jaguar.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, you almost had it.

content.description: Ross’s apartment. Ross is holding Ben.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [smells Ben’s butt] No no, you’re fine, you’re fine.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: [enters with Susan] Hello

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hi honey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh you guys are not gonna believe what happened.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, we were sitting over there playing on the floor and he grabs the table and he pulls himself up. He pulled himself up. Standing man. I’m sorry you guys missed it but I did tape it so it you guys want to see it.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Uhh, we know, he already did it last week.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: You can watch our tape if you want.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t believe this. I miss, I miss the first time of everything. I missed, what, the first time he rolled over, the first time he crawled. What else did I miss? Has he spoken yet, is he driving, does he have a favorite liquour?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Actually, he is getting closer on the talking thing. He can’t quite say mama yet, but once he said yumen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ooh, I, I’m so sick of missing stuff. Ya know, I want him for more than, than a day, I want him for a whole weekend. No listen , I mean, I feel like-

content.speaker: Carol & Susan
content.text: Great. That would be fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really? I mean, I, I had a whole speach prepared.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh shout, that would have been fun.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh look, did, did you just see that? Did you see? He just waved, he just waved, he’s never waved before, you’ve never waved before. Yes he has. Very good.

content.description: Central Perk. Monica and Rachel are there. Phoebe enters carrying video tapes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Phoebs, whatcha got there?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, Love Story , Brian’s Song , and Terms of Endearment .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, all you need now is The Killing Fields and some guacamole and you’ve got yourself a part-ay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I talked to my grandma about the Old Yeller incident, and she told me that my mom used to not show us the ends of sad movies to shield us from the pain and sadness. You know, before she killed herself.
[Chandler and Joey enter]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. Where is he, where’s Richard? Did you ditch him?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah right after we stole his lunch money and gave him a wedgie. What’s the matter with you, he’s parking the car.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So’d you guys have fun?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Your boyfriend is so cool.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, he let us drive his Jaguar. Joey for 12 blocks, me for 15.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, he must like you the best.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, what about that thing he did when he tipped the guy who showed us to our seats. You never even saw the money, it was like this. [With money in his palm] Hey Chandler, thanks for showing us to our seats [shakes his had and passes the dollar].

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re welcome. Hey Joey, thanks for parking the car [passes the dollar back].

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No problem. Hey Chandler

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think they get it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ok.
[Richard enters]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There’s the man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He-he-eyy. [Shakes his had and passes the dollar]

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hey, you’re gettin’ better. I’m gonna keep this by the way.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ok. He kept my dollar.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Carol and Susan are dropping off Ben.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So your first whole weekend without Ben, what’re you guys gonna do?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Uh, we’re going down to Colonial Williamsburg.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Yeah, a woman I went to college with just became the first female blacksmith down there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, ya know, they’re a little behind the times in Colonial Williamsburg.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Think I better go before mommy starts weeping.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Buy mommy.

content.speaker: Carol & Susan
content.text: We love you. Buy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Have a good time. Ok, Ben.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look. [they look at Joey in the kitchen with a cigar in his mouth, looking at his reflection in a spatula] Joey, do you know we can see you from here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How come Richard looks so much cooler with one of these than me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well for starters, you may want to light it and lose the spatula.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what, I think it’s cute, you trying to be more like Richard.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not like him, per-se, just not un-like him.
[Chandler enters with his hair full of mousse and a cheesy moustache]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look it’s the artist formerly known as Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Just tryin’ somethin’ here, ya know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So Joey, why didn’t you grow a moustache?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh we flipped for it. I got the cigar, he got the moustache. Figured if we both grew it, we’d look like dorks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, you really sidestepped that land mine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey listen, we’ve gotta go, I promised Richard we’d meet him downstairs.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re meeting Richard?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, we’re goin’ to a Ranger game.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, didn’t he tell ya?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, he told me he was going out with the guys, I just didn’t know that you were the guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You hear that? We’re the guys.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We’re the guys.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: With that moustache doesn’t Chandler remind you of Aunt Sylvia?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you.

content.description: Central Perk. Rachel is working. Ross enters with Ben.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, we’re visitiing. It’s Ben and his da-da. Da-da. Can you say da-da? Look, I’m gonna tell your momies you said it anyway so you might as well try.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No luck huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Naa. A while ago I got a sah out of him, which I thought, ya know, might turn into sah-condary caregiver but… Hey, would you uh, would you hold him for a sec, ’cause I, I gotta take this off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah sure, Ok. [she takes Ben and holds him at arms length]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’re you doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, I’m holding Ben.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well, he’s a baby not a bomb.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well just hold him like you’d hold a football.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This is how I would hold a football.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, here, here. There we go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, I’m sorry, I’m just not very good with babies. I mean I haven’t been around them, I mean, you know, since I was one.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s alright, it’s no big deal.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, definitely, I’m sure you’ll feel totally different when it’s our baby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You think about stuff like that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uhh, yeah. I mean, actually I kinda think that we’ll have, we’ll have two babies.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Two, two babies?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Ya know, a boy and a girl. Hopefully the girl will come first so Ben here won’t feel too competitive.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Then what’s gonna happen?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, we won’t wanna raise kids in the city so we’ll probably move to uh, Scarsdale.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, that way I figure, ya know, we’ll be far enough away from our parents that we don’t have to see them all the time but close enough that they can come over and babysit whenever we want. And yes, I know, the taxes are a little higher than, let’s say, Nassau county but the school system’s supposedly great.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow. Wow, that’s great. Great. Ok, wow, you know what.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m off my break now so uh, um here you take this [hands back Ben] and um, I am gonna go pour these very nice people some coffee. Ok. Oh look at that, I don’t have a pot. I don’t have a pot. Well, hey, maybe I’ve got one at home, or in Scarsdale. Hey is that a door? [leaves]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica and Richard are there. Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hey Phoebs, what’s happening?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, ok, murder, cancer, soccer teams eating each other in the Andes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So you watched the movies huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh huh, what is happening to the world? I mean, no no no, ’cause ET leaves, and and Rocky loses, Charlotte dies.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Charlotte who?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: With the web, the spider she dies, she does. She has babies and dies. It’s like ya know, hey welcome home from the hospital, thud.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, you wanna feel better?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, here, watch this.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s a Wonderful Life . Yes I’ve heard of this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So you can’t lose, it’s there in the title. Wonderfullness is baked right in.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Please, I almost fell for that with, uh, Pride of the Yankees , I thought I was gonna see a film about Yankee pride and then, boom, the guy gets Lou Gehrig’s disease.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Uh, the guy was Lou Gehrig. Didn’t you kinda see it coming?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Phoebe, just watch that, I promise it will resotre all your faith in humanity.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [runs in] Hey, big guy, game time.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hey, be right there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There’s a game?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, yeah, I just got my pick-up sticks back from the shop. Bring your nerves of steel.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: It’s the basketball playoffs.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Listen, um honey, I appreciate this but you don’t have to keep hanging out with them for me, I mean, they have each other.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, no, honey, I mean, don’t worry, I like hanging out with those guys. It’s fun for me. They’re different than my other friends, they don’t start sentences with, ‘You know who just died shoveling snow?’

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright that’s great, then just go. Go Knicks.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Uh, it’s the college playoffs.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, then go Vassar.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Uh, they’re not in it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, then just go.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Ok. [leaves]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, why does this bother me so much? I mean I don’t wanna be one of those people who tells their boyfriend they wanna spend 24 hours a day with them.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s just that he doesn’t have that much free time, ya know, and I don’t know, what do I do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Does it matter? You’re ultimately just gonna die or get divorced or have to blow your pets head off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [enters] Aghh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Me too. [leaves]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ve got a question. Richard made plans again with the guys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah well, Ross just made plans for the whole century.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ya know what, I think I’m gonna go to my room and read Cosmo, maybe there’s something helpful in there. Know what, at least maybe I can learn how to do an at home bikini wax with leftover Cristmas candles.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [enters] Ok, what the hell happened back there?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, you tell me. One minute I’m holding Ben like a football, the next thing I know, I’ve got two kids, I’m living in Scarsdale complaining about the taxes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I’m sorry, I think about stuff. Ya know, I mean, you’re at work, you’re assembling bones, your mind wanders.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, you have planned out the next 20 years of our lives, we’ve been dating for six weeks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon, what, you never think about our future?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, but I, I think about who’s apartment we’re gonna sleep at tomorrow night and, and where we’re gonna have dinner next Saturday night. I do not think about what our childrens’ names are gonna be. You know what our childrens names are gonna be.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, I mean, ya know, I, I read a book and there was a girl named Emily and I thought, I thought that might be good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What was the book?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The big book of childrens’ names.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, Ross, Ross, ok listen, what we have is amazing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I do not want to have everything decided for me. I spent my whole life like that. It’s what I had with Barry, that was one of the reasons I left. I, I like not knowing right now and I’m sorry if that scares you but if you want to be with me you are gonna have to deal with that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re not done.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I didn’t know that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, then you’re gonna have to understand that you’re with a guy who’s not gonna stop planning his future with you because he knows that we’re gonna end up together and if that scares you, tough, ’cause you’re gonna have to deal with that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine, I will.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good, ’cause I love you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well I love you too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well that’s the first time we’ve said that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes it is.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m gonna kiss you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well you better.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica is in the kitchen, Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey. Oh thanks for the great movie tip.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you like it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah. You know, I don’t know if I was happier when um George Bailey destroyed the family business or um, Donna Reid cried, or when the mean pharmacist made his ear bleed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, I’ll give you the ear thing but don’t you think the ending was pretty wonderful?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I didn’t watch the ending, I was too depressed. It just kept getting worse and worse, it should have been called, “It’s a sucky life and just when you think it can’t suck any more it does.”

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Chandler and Joey are playing Richard at foosball.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Kick save and… denied.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: But… he gets it back, pass to the middle, lines it up and… BAM! Yes! Could that shot BE any prettier?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man you are incredible.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well, we had a table in college.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh really, I didn’t know they had foosball in the 1800’s.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Nice moustache by the way. When puberty hits that thing’s really gonna kick in.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [enters] Honey. Uh, not to sound too Florence Henderson but, dinner’s on the table.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Ok, just one more point.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [grabs the other two bars on Richard’s side and scores] Score! Now can we go?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See, that’s why we don’t let her play.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Is everything all right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Uh-oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh hey listen, don’t be mad at him, it’s our fault. I’m sorry we’ve been hoggin so much of his time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, he’s just really great to hang around with.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No no, seriously, Chandler and I were just talkin about this. He is so much cooler than our dads. [Chandler starts kicking him below the table] I mean, you know, our dad’s are ok, ya know, but Richard is just- ow, ow. What are you kickin me for? Huh? I’m tryin to talk here.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Uh, you guys see me as a dad?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nooooo.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Your just, your just clearly not familiar with our young persons vernacular. See, when we say dad, we mean buddy. We mean pal.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Uh-huh, yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No no, seriously, Joey’s my dad, Monica’s my dad. I’ve even got some dads down at work.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: That’s fine. Well, your other dad and I are gonna go have a romantic evening and I guess I’ll just see you kids around.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nighty-nite.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re not a dad. You’re not a dad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not a dad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe you got us into trouble. [slaps Joey on the arm. Joey takes exception and slaps him back]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [her and Richard return to her place] So are you ok?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah, just, I feel like I’m about a hundred. I thought I was just one of the guys.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come here. I’ll make you feel like one of the guys. You know for a really cool guy, you suck at foosball.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: What’re you talkin’ about, I was killin’ ’em.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, well they suck too.

content.description: Ross’s apartment. Rachel is changing Ben’s diaper under Ross’s supervision.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, and then you take the poopie diaper and you put it in the poopie diaper pail.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok Ross, just so you know, calling it a poopie diaper doesn’t make this process any cuter.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [doorbell buzzes] Hello.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: It’s us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on up. I’m gonna get the rest of his stuff together. [walks in his room]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, we can do this now, can’t we Ben? Yes we can, yes we can. [finishes the diaper] There. I did it. I did it. Look at that, oh, stays on and everything. Hi.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, what did you just say? Did you just say hi? Oh my God, Ross, Ross, Ben just said ‘Hi’.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha, what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ben just said hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, the word hi?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ye-, no, my Uncle Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great, great, and I miss that too, I miss everything.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry, I guess I just bring it out in him.

content.speaker: Carol & Susan
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Guess what. Ben just said his first word.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: What did he say?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Something about hi.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: That’s so exciting.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Mommy is so proud of you. Hi. Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know, actually it’s more like, hi.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Ok, this could go on for a while.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: We’ve got a cab waiting downstairs.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, this was fun. Uh, we should really do it again sometime, wha’dya say? Ok. Alright so I’ve got him.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Tuesday.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Tuesday right. Ok, bye you guys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Take care.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye Ben.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did, did he just, did he, did he just say, he said bye. He said bye. You said, you said bye to me. You said bye to me.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Suddenly I’m seeing him go off to college.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: We’ve gotta go, we’ve got that cab waiting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, alright, ok. Bye.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Phoebe is watching Bert and Ernie with Ben.

content.speaker: Ernie
content.text: Oh wow, look at this nice deep hole I’ve been digging. Hey Bert, isn’t this a nice hole here. Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [pauses the tape] Ok, Ben, this is the part where Ernie buries Bert in the sand and can’t find him. Now, I’ve looked ahead on the tape and he does find him again. But, ok, before that happens, there’s some pretty rough goin’ for a while but I think we can handle it. And, there’s just the alphabet but we know that ends well so. Ok, here we go. [starts the tape again]

content.speaker: Ernie
content.text: Bert, Bert. Bert. Hey, what happened to my friend Bert? He was here just a moment ago. Oh no, my old friend Bert is lost.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m so glad you’re here.
